title: Father of toddler wounded in accidental shooting arrested, DPD says
content:
Autoplay:Child recovering after accidental shootingCONNECTING...XBoy wounded, father arrested in Denver shooting
DENVER - The father of a child injured in an accidental shooting at a home in the Ruby Hill neighborhood early Saturday afternoon has been arrested and is now being investigated for a weapons offense, authorities said.
Police say the victim in the shooting, a 3-year-old boy, is stable.
The shooting was reported just before noon inside the family home in the area of West Mississippi Avenue and South Raritan Street.
Police outside condo where child was reportedly shot. #denver7 pic.twitter.com/CWep7Tt73d
— Eric Lupher (@EricLupher7) May 21, 2016
Police are still trying to figure out how the gun was fired in the first place. Additional charges are possible as the investigation continues, a DPD official said.
